evs.name: Family status certificate
evs.description: Issued by the Municipality, KEP (Citizen Service Centers), or via www.gov.gr. Required only if requested due to inability to cross-check data.

evs.name: Certificate of enrollment
evs.description: Certificate of enrollment for children attending recognized educational institutions or IEK (Vocational Training Institutes) and are over 18 years old.

evs.name: Disability certification from KEPA
evs.description: Disability assessment issued by the Disability Certification Centers (KEPA) or other competent health committees, for dependent children with a disability rate of 67% or higher.

evs.name: Death certificate
evs.description: Extract of the Death Certificate, for close relatives of the deceased.

evs.name: Court decision
evs.description: Court decision regarding absence, judicial support, or irrevocable court decision on guardianship.

evs.name: EU citizen registration certificate or permanent residence permit
evs.description: EU citizen registration certificate or permanent residence permit for EU citizens or foreigners.

evs.name: Special Identity Card for Expatriate Greeks
evs.description: For expatriate Greeks, the Special Identity Card for Expatriate Greeks.

evs.name: Residence permit for foreigners
evs.description: Residence permit for non-EU citizens or citizens from countries belonging to the European Economic Area.

evs.name: Income tax return
evs.description: Proof of permanent and legal residence in the country by submitting an income tax return for each fiscal year.

criterion_requirments.name:
The equivalent family income determines the category: 
- Category A: up to €6,000 (€70/month for the 1st and 2nd dependent, €140/month for the 3rd and subsequent dependents) 
- Category B: from €6,001 to €10,000 (€42/month for the 1st and 2nd dependent, €84/month for the 3rd and subsequent dependents) 
- Category C: from €10,001 to €15,000 (€28/month for the 1st and 2nd dependent, €56/month for the 3rd and subsequent dependents). 
Before each payment, a recheck is conducted based on amended E1 tax declarations.

The applicant must have been permanently residing in the country for the last 5 years (for Greeks) or legally and permanently for 12 years (for citizens of other countries), proven by submitting an income tax return for each fiscal year.

Eligible beneficiaries are: 
- Greek citizens 
- Expatriate Greeks with a Special Identity Card for Expatriate Greeks 
- Citizens of EU member states 
- Citizens of EEA countries (Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein) and Switzerland 
- Recognized refugees 
- Stateless persons 
- Beneficiaries of humanitarian status 
- Citizens of other countries with legal residence

Foreigners or expatriate Greeks holding a Special Identity Card for Expatriate Greeks must, upon application submission, have valid residence permits or attach them electronically if they cannot be cross-checked electronically.

Dependent children are considered: 
- Unmarried children from marriage, natural, step, or recognized, up to 18 years old (or 19 if attending Secondary Education) 
- Children enrolled in compulsory education with sufficient attendance and registration for the current school year 
- Children over 18 attending universities, TEI, IEK, Colleges, or post-secondary schools (until the end of their 24th year) 
- Children with a disability rate of 67% or higher (until the end of their 24th year)
Dependent children must reside in Greece, unless their absence is due to studies at recognized institutions abroad.
